texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The interest in the  openstack-ansible-security  role has taken off faster than I expected, and one piece of constant feedback I received was around the name of the role. Some users were unsure if they needed to use the role in an OpenStack cloud or if the OpenStack-Ansible project was required.
texts.text: The interest in the  openstack-ansible-security  role has taken off faster than I expected, and one piece of constant feedback I received was around the name of the role. Some users were unsure if they needed to use the role in an OpenStack cloud or if the OpenStack-Ansible project was required.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The role works everywhere - OpenStack cloud or not. I started a  mailing list thread  on the topic and we eventually settled on a new name:  ansible-hardening ! The updated documentation is  already available .
texts.text: The role works everywhere - OpenStack cloud or not. I started a  mailing list thread  on the topic and we eventually settled on a new name:  ansible-hardening ! The updated documentation is  already available .

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The old openstack-ansible-security role is being retired and it will not receive any additional updates. Moving to the new role is easy:
texts.text: The old openstack-ansible-security role is being retired and it will not receive any additional updates. Moving to the new role is easy:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Change your playbooks to use the ansible-hardening role
texts.text: Change your playbooks to use the ansible-hardening role

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: There's no need to change any variable names or tags - they are all kept the same in the new role.
texts.text: There's no need to change any variable names or tags - they are all kept the same in the new role.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: As always, if you have questions or comments about the role, drop by
texts.text: As always, if you have questions or comments about the role, drop by

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: on Freenode IRC or  open a bug in Launchpad .
texts.text: on Freenode IRC or  open a bug in Launchpad .
